top_categories.workout_context: At 104 miles, Unbound Gravel 100 punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Racing Unbound Gravel 100 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Unbound Gravel 100’s flint rock roads, chunky gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Unbound Gravel 100’s flint hills gravel—sharp rocks that destroy tires and spirits and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Unbound Gravel 100 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Every session at Unbound Gravel 100 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Unbound Gravel 100 — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Unbound Gravel 100. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Unbound Gravel 100 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
At 104 miles, Unbound Gravel 100 rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Unbound Gravel 100 — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on flint hills gravel—sharp rocks that destroy tires and spirits.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Unbound Gravel 100’s flint hills gravel—sharp rocks that destroy tires and spirits delivers on race day.

race_overlay.heat: June in Emporia, Kansas — Late May/early June in Kansas means 85-95°F highs with high humidity. Full sun exposure on open prairies. Thunderstorms are a perennial threat. The 2023 edition saw brutal mud conditions in the morning. 'Whatever brutal weather Kansas decides to serve up.'. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Unbound Gravel 100 — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day. Race-day realities: Extreme heat (85-100°F possible); High humidity causing fluid loss.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Unbound Gravel 100’s 104 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Unbound Gravel 100 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on flint hills gravel—sharp rocks that destroy tires and spirits to build confidence. Expect: flint rock roads, chunky gravel, paved transfers.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 104 miles of flint hills gravel—sharp rocks that destroy tires and spirits in Emporia, Kansas.
